newsitem.title: UK: IPE natural gas trade scrappy and volumes thin.
newsitem.headline: IPE natural gas trade scrappy and volumes thin.

text.p: IPE natural gas trade failed to pick up speed in the afternoon trading session, leaving prices little changed and trading volumes painfully thin.
Just 70 lots changed hands over the day, with the apathetic atmosphere failing to lend impetus to a significant price move in either direction, dealers said.
The afternoon session saw five deals of five lots each on the front-month May, adding to the morning's tally of nine trades in summer and winter months.
"These levels are really disappointing. All the trades were single deals, there were no big chunks traded at all," said one dealer.
May last traded 0.030 pence per therm (p/th) up at 10.250 p/th.
Higher volumes seen last week were the result of big players in the over-the-counter market choosing to use the futures market because of its anonymity.
"Prices aren't moving around a great deal at the moment, so people don't see the need to come in (to the IPE market). What we need is a bit of volatility," a broker said.
